text:
Professor's Note: A common “trick” in direct method questions is to provide
information on depreciation expense along with other operating cash flow
components. When using the direct method, ignore depreciation expense—it's a
noncash charge. We'll see later that we do consider depreciation expense in indirect
method computations, but we do this solely because depreciation expense and
other noncash expenses have been subtracted in calculating net income (our
starting point) and need to be added back to get cash flow.
